title: District 7 Wines 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Light berry aromas meet with wet gravel and dank forest-floor elements of pine needle and juniper on the nose of this bottling. The earthy forest-moss flavor is prevalent on the sip, leveled by cranberry, pomegranate and smoke elements. It is a decent everyday Pinot.

title: Cesari 2014 Bosan  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
description: This friendly red opens with aromas of blackberry, vanilla and a whiff of bitter almond. On the palate, it doles out black cherry, fig and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Château de Santenay 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: An attractive, soft, red cherry flavored wine, this is ready to drink. Acidity cuts easily through the ripe fruits and soft texture. The juicy aftertaste keeps it bright and fruity.

title: Blanco Nieva 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Lime and lemon aromas are clean and direct on the nose. This well-cut Sauvignon Blanc is crisp and light weight, with salty green-apple and citrus flavors that linger on the finish.

title: Bodegas Campante 2016 Viña Reboreda Godello (Ribeiro)
description: Fresh mineral and white-fruit aromas are clean as a whistle. This Godello from Galicia is crisp in feel, with dry, melony flavors and a hint of green.

title: Bokisch 2016 Terra Alta Vineyard Albariño (Lodi)
description: Light body, fresh and tangy fruit flavors and crisp acidity make this a lively, refreshing wine to sip before or during a meal. It resembles honeydew melon and green apples in the aroma, and stays fruity but not heavy on the palate.

title: Bonterra 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This light-bodied wine made from organic grapes seems earthy at first whiff but settles down to crisp citrus flavors, good cleansing acidity and very fresh herb and melon flavors. It's just the thing to pair with light appetizers and seafood.

title: Château Marsac Séguineau 2015  Margaux
description: Linked by ownership to another Margaux estate, Tour de Mons, this wine reflects the ripe fruit of the vintage. Its tannins are still firm although they are well balanced by the bright black-currant fruit. This generous wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: District 7 Wines 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)
description: Still tight on the nose, this well-priced bottling shows tar, black pepper, dried cherries, leather and crushed pencil aromas. The sip starts with sweetish black currant before cedary spice, black olive and wood smoke take hold. The tannins are soft and polished.

title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits
description: Crisp and cool, this attractive wine is bright with creamed-apple flavors. It is all fruit, tangy, bright with citrus and likely to be ready to drink soon, from mid 2018.

title: 14 Hands 2016 Reserve Chenin Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine's aromas are bright and focused, with honeycrisp apple, passion fruit and pear notes. The apple and stone fruit flavors are off dry, showing no obvious oak influence.

title: 14 Hands 2016 The Reserve Unoaked Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Apple, cream and straw aromas are followed by straightforward stone fruit flavors in this wine. It's a quite enjoyable example of this variety and style.

title: Adalia 2016 Laute  (Valpolicella)
description: Aromas of red-skinned berry, white pepper and a whiff of mint float out of the glass. Light bodied and fresh, the palate evokes Marasca cherry, white pepper and cinnamon alongside supple tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Alyris 2015 The Audition Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is an intensely thick and concentrated wine, richly ripe in caramelized apple, tropical mango and hugely grippy toasted oak. There's a thread of jasmine that pierces through beautifully on the nose.

title: Amavi 2016 Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine includes 15% Sauvignon Blanc and hails from Les Collines, Goff and Seven Hills vineyards. Aged in neutral French oak, it shows gooseberry, anise, straw, fig and lees aromas, which lead to broad, creamy-feeling fruit flavors. Give it some time to open up.

title: Animale 2014 Reserve Petite Sirah (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine's black pepper, Band Aid, flower and herb aromas are followed by full-bodied but soft and pure fruit flavors. There are good things going on here, but they don't quite come together.

title: Artadi 2012 Santa Cruz de Artazu Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Pushy oak on the nose results in grainy aromas and cheesy notes. This warm-vintage Garnacha from Navarra feels tight and pulling, with choppy tannins. Oaky flavors of blackberry are raw and bumpy across a hot and scratchy finish.

title: Avensole 2016 Susan Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Loads of fresh passion fruit kick off the nose of this exuberant bottling, although there are telltale touches of cut grass and green grapefruit pith in the background. There's a pleasing and round freshness to the sip, where ripe stone fruit meets with more sour edges of lime skin and grass.

title: Barton 2016 Holiday See Canyon Vineyard Albariño (San Luis Obispo)
description: Lemon-lime soda concentrate, grapefruit, honey and chamomile make for a broad, somewhat rich nose on this bottling. The sip shows lots of freshness and acidic zip, with waxy, almost bitter flavors of lemon skin, sour pink grapefruit and the lightest hints of wood.

title: Domaine des Crets 2015 Climat En Bout  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)
description: This is a toasty wine, full of vanilla and wood flavors. With the richness of the vintage, the fruit also makes itself known, with ripe apricots crisped with citrus acidity. The wine could do with a few more months, so drink from mid 2018.

title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2016 A la Côte  (Saint-Véran)
description: Based in the village of Fuissé, this estate also has vines in Saint-Véran. This wine is ripe and creamy, with attractive citrus and green apple fruits. It has a light touch, with fruit and acidity easily in balance. Drink the wine now.

title: Finca la Celia 2014 Elite Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: This wine's ripe, baked berry aromas suggest cigar box, pipe tobacco and raisins. It's heavy, stewed and choppy on the palate, saturated with prune, raisin and chocolate flavors. The finish is short and hints at overripeness.

title: Gamache 2014 188° SW Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is made from 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Cabernet Franc, and all of the fruit comes from the famed Ciel du Cheval Vineyard. Vanilla, coconut, ripe plum, clove, cinnamon, barrel spice and herb aromas lead to even-keeled red and black fruit flavors that are surprisingly elegant for the appellation and vintage.

title: Goose Ridge 2014 Cellar Select Artist Series Estate Bottled Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is 73% Mourvèdre, 11% Grenache, 7% Syrah, 6% Petite Sirah and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon. Barrel notes are upfront, with vanilla, dill and baking spice aromas accenting cherry and white pepper scents. The palate mixes fruit and barrel characteristics but comes up a bit short on the finish.
designation: Cellar Select Artist Series Estate Bottled

title: Goose Ridge 2015 GRV White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of 55% Viognier, 23% Grenache Blanc and 22% Roussanne. Its light apple, vanilla, citrus and spice aromas are followed by creamy, thick-feeling fruit flavors that persist on the spice-filled finish. It comes off quite heavy.

title: Gotas de Mar 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny white-fruit aromas are lean, with a pyrazinic note of jalapeño. Stone fruit flavors show on the palate, but with a mild bitterness. Nectarine is the lead on a short-run finish. Drink now.

title: Hard Row To Hoe 2014 S&M Red (Lake Chelan)
description: This wine is a blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Malbec. The aromas seem a bit unsettled, with herb, dill and wood spice notes that don't come together. The palate packs a mouthful of smooth cherry and plum flavors—they're downright delicious but seem a bit disconnected to the aromas.

title: Kaena 2014 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Concentrated fruit aromas of red plum, reduced strawberry and gingerbread are a bit much on the nose of this bottling. The cooked flavors are very kirsch-like, with concentrated cherry and plum, yet there is still a compelling tannic structure and a strong acidity.

title: La Chouette 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine captures the freshness that La Chouette's Pinot Noirs are known for. Its wild strawberry and tart cherry fruit comes with an ample dose of fresh herb notes. Drink now through 2020.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2016 Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)
description: Offering delicate whiffs of blossom and nectarine, this is a soft-spoken Gewürztraminer. Off dry in style, it's an easy-drinking white, with juicy grapefruit and peach flavors. The finish is long, extended by a hint of bitter almond skin. Drink now through 2019.
